intro: Hymenodictyon timoranum, commonly known as the Timor starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often elliptical in shape. The flowers are small and clustered, with five petals that are usually white or pale yellow.
